Click through to meet the current Spurs, and their younger selves.

Age: 28 Salary: $10,000,000 Image 53 of 53 Then and now: 2015-16 Spurs before they made it to the NBA 1 / 53 Back to Gallery Spurs Nation is gearing up for another title quest, and with a number of new faces in town there is a new electricity in the air.
In some ways this year's group feels like a completely new team, and even though the Big Three and other fan favorites are still on the roster, we have some bonding to do with this version of the Spurs.
The centerpiece for this title run is Lamarcus Aldridge, who many Texas fans remember from his brief time playing for the University of Texas at Austin Longhorns. But who was David West in his younger days? And where did Ray McCallum play before the pros?
RELATED: Australian Who Wants to be a Millionaire contestant stumped by question about Spurs, Patty Mills
Many of us remember Tim Duncan's dominant time at Wake Forest, when he began his ascension to the very top of the basketball world, and the day the Spurs drafted him.
But few of us have seen the pre-NBA careers of foreign-born players like Tony Parker, Manu Ginobili and Boris Diaw.
We are about to scream our faces off for these guys on a wild emotional roller coaster we call the NBA season, so let's get to know them a little better with a look back at who they were before the NBA stardom.
ceudaily@mysa.com
@chrisudaily
